intro: Peucedanum paishanense, commonly known as the Tibetan cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
